repnme.cdata!:
Mozambique - Economic and Financial
            Management Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Economic and Financial
            Management Technical Assistance Project for Mozambique were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, project
            sustainability was likely, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was also
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: success in
            capacity building depends in large part on the commitment
            evinced by the beneficiaries. This was evident in the Bank
            of Mozambique (BOM) computerization; the creation and
            implementation of the technical unit in the Ministry of
            Finance (MOF) directorate of plan; and various training
            actions. To generate that commitment from the start and
            insure the best level of execution, borrowers should be
            actively involved in project preparation and design. When
            technical assistant (TA) consultants are selected, they
            should be required to commit themselves to transfer their
            own skills through on-the-job training. Skills transfer was
            successfully achieved in the case of two main subcomponents:
            the computerization at BOM and the creation of the Central
            Technical Project Unit (UTCP) at Ministry of Plan and
            Finance (MPF). In Mozambique, given the civil war being
            fought as the credit was launched, a more realistic
            implementation timetable should have been set, especially in
            connection with recruiting TA consultants.

docna.cdata!:
Mozambique - Economic And Financial
            Management Technical Assistance Project : Credit 2066 -
            Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Mozambique - Economic And

            2066 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

repnme.cdata!:
Mozambique - Economic and Financial
            Management Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic and Financial Management
            Technical Assistance Project hopes to provide institutional
            support to the Ministry of Finance (MOF) and the Bank of
            Mozambique (BOM). The project consists of two main
            components. The first component is for MOF to provide
            assistance to: (a) the Economic Analysis and Price
            Department in the National Treasury Directorate to improve
            the collection and analysis of economic information for
            policy formulation; (b) the National Budget Directorate to
            improve capital budgeting; and (c) the carrying out of an
            accounting training program. The second component is for BOM
            to provide assistance to: (a) strengthen the Economic
            Research Department to improve data collection, economic
            analysis and policy formulation including the establishment
            of a Documentation Center; (b) improve banking operations by
            computerizing banking systems and introducing modern
            equipment; and (c) strengthen the legal advisory services
            provided within BOM, especially regarding external financing
            and negotiations with creditors.
